description: Latin aula (“forecourt”), from Ancient Greek αὐλά (aulá), the form of αὐλή (aulḗ, “forecourt”) in dialects other than Ionic and Attic.

nouns.description: aula (plural aulas or aulae or aulæ)

examples: [I]n a healthy environment, young Mahoney might have taken the risk, both with University and, in part, with entering the Aula for the jibs dance.

entries.meaning: (anatomy, obsolete) The anterior part of the third ventricle of the brain leading to the lateral ventricles.
